scripts.name: hello.py
scripts.description: print "Hello, TEALS UAG!"

scripts.description: Print 1 through 5.

scripts.name: count10.py
scripts.description: Print 1 through 10.

scripts.name: count476.py
scripts.description: Print 1 through 476.

scripts.name: countN.py
scripts.description: Ask for N, then print 1 through N.

scripts.name: sum55.py
scripts.description: Sum the first 55 integers.

scripts.name: sum456.py
scripts.description: Sum the first 456 integers.

scripts.name: sumN.py
scripts.description: Ask for N, then print the sum of the first N integers.

scripts.name: sumAll.py
scripts.description: As long as the user types a number, sum it. Print the total after the first empty line.

scripts.name: prod8.py
scripts.description: Print the product of the first 8 integers.

scripts.name: prod55.py
scripts.description: Sum the first 55 integers.

scripts.name: prod456.py
scripts.description: Sum the first 456 integers.

scripts.name: prodN.py
scripts.description: Ask for N, then print the product of the first N integers.

scripts.name: prodAll.py
scripts.description: As long as the user types a number, multiply it. Print after the first empty line.

scripts.name: avg489.py
scripts.description: Calculate and print the average of 4, 8, 9

scripts.name: avgN.py
scripts.description: Ask for a number N, then ask for that many integers. Calculate and print the average.

scripts.name: avgAll.py
scripts.description: As long as the user types a number, sum it. Print the average after the first empty line.

scripts.name: roman.py
scripts.description: Handle integer to roman numeral, for one input.

scripts.name: romanTable.py
scripts.description: Print a table of Roman Numerals. First column is 1 through 10. Second column is 10 through 100, by 10. Third column is 100 through 1000, by 100. Use pyqb's `at`.

scripts.name: romanMany.py
scripts.description: Ask for numbers until the user enters a blank line, printing the roman numeral each time.

scripts.name: grade.py
scripts.description: Ask for a test score (1 to 100). Print out the letter grade.

scripts.name: gradeAll.py
scripts.description: Ask for several test scores. Print the number of As, Bs, Cs, etc.
